greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(A087686(n)) = 2*a(n-1), a(A088359(n)) = 1+2*a(n), where A088359 and A087686 = numbers that occur only once (resp. more than once) in A004001, the Hofstadter-Conway $10000 sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
T. Kubo and R. Vakil, On Conway's recursive sequence, Discr. Math. 152 (1996), 225-252.
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Equally, for n > 1, if A093879(n-1) = 0, a(n) = 2*a(n - A004001(n)), otherwise a(n) = 1 + 2*a(A004001(n)-1). [Above formula in a more symmetric form.]
As a composition of other permutations:
a(2^n) = 2^n. [Follows from the properties (3) and (4) of A004001 given on page 227 of Kubo & Vakil paper.]
xref: Cf. also permutations A266411, A266412 and arrays A265901, A265903.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 10 2016
